channel.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
channel.description:
I have been able to easily host demonik's and other servers, but RSCD v25 is a bit of a pickle. Error I get is: [code] Buildfile: build.xml
runls: [java] Login Server starting up... [java] Connected to MySQL [java] LoginEngine now running [java] java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind [java] at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source) [java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.registerN ew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.access$80 0(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$Worker.ru n(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [java] at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NamePreservin gRunnable.java:51) [java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [java] Java Result: 1
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 0 seconds Press any key to continue . . .[/code] Now, there are NONE java.exe processes in my task manager processes menu, and I certainly have all ports opened (8181, 34522, 43594). I also have MSN and WAMP running. What could be the problem? I could read from that error that any of those ports was in use but I tried changing them (to a random nr, like 19948), but still, got the same error. All the IPs in ls.conf and world.xml are my own ip's (from www.whatismyip.com), in conf.xml(at conf\server\conf.xml) I have both ips set on localhost. Even when I set ALL ips in all config files into my whatismyip.com address, I still get that error.
So, any help probably?

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

open your world.xml.

make your you have this 127.0.0.1 and it must be 127.0.0.1, or write localhost if that does not work. last case scenario check your hosts file to see if its redirecting your localhost ports.

Read full topic

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @craws craws
item.description:
@craws wrote:

When I forwarded the ports same way for Demonik’s (this year March), I forwarded both 43594-s, UDP and TCP. Just in case. And functioned fully.

And I did the same way with port 80 (to host web) which I am hosting successfully, as we speak.

Read full topic

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“craws, post:5, topic:236658”]I forwarded both, UDP & TCP ports. There is no matter, if I forwarded both, I think.
All possible combinations.[/quote]You must of done something wrong with the portforwarding if it works fine with localhost. Offtopic: I am a good mod, and I’ve done a great job moderating so far, regardless of what you think.

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“craws, post:3, topic:236658”]Do you really think I haven’t had experiences with Demonik/RSCD v5 before? They were alot easier and less issues/security holes. editing config files to get loginserver to run successfully isn’t related to knowing c++/java in any way, does it now, son? Fail.

Ow… restart my computer? That’s a lame answer, you could say it to a new moparscaper, who makes a thread with “HELP PLZ CODE SERVER nfubs”. If I set them all to localhost, I can run it successfully, but then again, other people can’t connect, can they now?

And all java-related processes are terminated…

/“cr0ss”[/quote]At least I can get a server running and not pretend to know how to. You may be the next mubby. Make sure you port forwarded properly. Also, don’t evade mute’s please.

Read full topic

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25

item.description:
@craws wrote:

Do you really think I haven’t had experiences with Demonik/RSCD v5 before? They were alot easier and less issues/security holes. editing config files to get loginserver to run successfully isn’t related to knowing c++/java in any way, does it now, son? Fail.

Ow… restart my computer? That’s a lame answer, you could say it to a new moparscaper, who makes a thread with “HELP PLZ CODE SERVER nfubs”. If I set them all to localhost, I can run it successfully, but then again, other people can’t connect, can they now?

And all java-related processes are terminated…

/“cr0ss”

Read full topic
item.source: Issue trying to host RSCD v25

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

I lol’d irl at you flaming me for not knowing c++/java (when I do), when you don’t even know what a bind error means that java.exe is already in use and is binded to a port. You can’t even set up a server successfully, let alone even begin to code one yet you flame me? Lol, you fail more than mubby.

Anyways: try restarting your computer and see if that works, or try setting all the ips to localhost. Also make sure that you don’t have any java.exe processes running, even though you said you don’t, check again because you might of not seen one that is running.

Read full topic
item.source: Issue trying to host RSCD v25

item.title: Issue trying to host RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @cr0ss cr0ss
item.description:
@cr0ss wrote:

I have been able to easily host demonik’s and other servers, but RSCD v25 is a bit of a pickle.
Error I get is:

[code]
Buildfile: build.xml

runls:
[java] Login Server starting up…
[java] Connected to MySQL
[java] LoginEngine now running
[java] java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind
[java] at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method)
[java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source)
[java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source)
[java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.registerN
ew(SocketAcceptor.java:363)
[java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.access$80
0(SocketAcceptor.java:55)
[java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$Worker.ru
n(SocketAcceptor.java:222)
[java] at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NamePreservin
gRunnable.java:51)
[java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
[java] Java Result: 1

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 0 seconds
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Now, there are NONE java.exe processes in my task manager processes menu, and I certainly have all ports opened (8181, 34522, 43594).
I also have MSN and WAMP running.
What could be the problem? I could read from that error that any of those ports was in use but I tried changing them (to a random nr, like 19948), but still, got the same error.
All the IPs in ls.conf and world.xml are my own ip’s (from www.whatismyip.com), in conf.xml(at conf\server\conf.xml) I have both ips set on localhost. Even when I set ALL ips in all config files into my whatismyip.com address, I still get that error.

So, any help probably?
